DOC.brief_summary: OBJECTIVES : I . Determine induction durable remission patient life-threatening systemic lupus erythematosus antiphospholipid antibody syndrome treat cyclophosphamide . II . Determine toxicity drug patient .
DOC.brief_title: Pilot Study Cyclophosphamide Patients With Life-Threatening Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Antiphospholipid Antibody Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: PROTOCOL OUTLINE : Patients receive cyclophosphamide IV day 1-4 filgrastim ( G-CSF ) begin day 10 continue blood count recover . Patients follow monthly 6 month , every 3 month thereafter .
DOC.criteria: PROTOCOL ENTRY CRITERIA : Disease Characteristics Diagnosis lifethreatening systemic lupus erythematosus ( SLE ) ; must show least 4 American College Rheumatology criterion SLE ; must severe organ damage 1 organ ; must 1 follow indication ongoing disease activity : disease activity score ( SLEDAI ) least 4 , hospitalization disease activity within 12 month , lifethreatening disease capture SLEDAI OR Diagnosis antiphospholipid antibody syndrome Hughes criterion ; must show severity ongoing symptom sign hypercoagulability spite warfarin therapy Patient Characteristics Hepatic : Bilirubin great 2.0 mg/dL ; transaminases great 2.0 time normal Renal : Creatinine great 3.0 mg/dL Cardiovascular : Ejection fraction least 45 % Pulmonary : FVC , FEV1 , DLCO least 50 % predict Other : Not preterminal moribund ; pregnant nursing ; fertile patient must use effective contraception
